channel.title: Help ASAP! (NPC Talking Error)

item.title: Help ASAP! (NPC Talking Error)
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

[quote=“Sanskrit, post:7, topic:365833”]“class, interface, or enum expected” always means you either have too many or too few brackets, or your missing a semicolon after the end of a statement. the number of “{” brackets should match the number of “}” within the code.[/quote]Ok Guys… I Fixed It Myself HalfWAy… I Got 0 Errors but the NPC InGame Don’t Say It…
NPCHandler Code…

if (npcs[i].npcType == 98) //npc id, the npc that says it. if (misc.random2(10) <= 1) //Time between saying your text. { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome To The Donator Zone! Thanks For Your Donation!"; //change that to what you want. }
“== 98) //npc” is where i made the change to get rid of errors…

Read full topic

item.title: Help ASAP! (NPC Talking Error)
item.dc:creator: @Sanskrit Sanskrit
item.description:
@Sanskrit wrote:

“class, interface, or enum expected” always means you either have too many or too few brackets, or your missing a semicolon after the end of a statement. the number of “{” brackets should match the number of “}” within the code.

Read full topic

item.title: Help ASAP! (NPC Talking Error)
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

First of all, calm down, I’m not killing your mother, I’m only try to help.
Second of all, I’m reading the compiler. It says “reached end of file while parsing”
This means that there isn’t a corresponding bracket with the ones that you have. Look it up on google.
Example:
http://forums.java.net/jive/thread.jspa?threadID=25942

if that doesn’t work, just play around with the brackets, add 20 if you feel the urge too. Find what works.

Read full topic

item.title: Help ASAP! (NPC Talking Error)
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

[quote=“DivineSouls, post:2, topic:365833”]Looks like too many brackets from the code you gave me. Try deleting one of the brackets.[/quote]Compiler Now…

.\src\NPCHandler.java:3482: illegal start of expression public boolean ResetAttackNPC(int NPCID) { ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3482: ';' expected public boolean ResetAttackNPC(int NPCID) { ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3482: ';' expected public boolean ResetAttackNPC(int NPCID) { ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3496: illegal start of expression public boolean ResetAttackPlayer(int NPCID) { ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3496: ';' expected public boolean ResetAttackPlayer(int NPCID) { ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3496: ';' expected public boolean ResetAttackPlayer(int NPCID) { ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3508: reached end of file while parsing }→ ^ 7 errors Press any key to continue . . .

NPCHandler Code Now…

if (npcs[i].npcType == 98) { //npc id, the npc that says it. if (misc.random2(10) <= 1) //Time between saying your text. { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome To The Donator Zone! Thanks For Your Donation!"; //change that to what you want. }

item.title: Help ASAP! (NPC Talking Error)
item.dc:creator: @Perses_Pkers Perses Pkers
item.description:
@Perses_Pkers wrote:

Ok Guys I Was Tryting To Get A NPC To Talk… I Have NPC In The Cords I Want it… But I Got Errors Adding to “NPCHandler” Here Is The Compiler Errors!

Starting compiler! compiling please wait. .\src\NPCHandler.java:3485: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean ResetAttackNPC(int NPCID) { ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3488: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].IsAttackingNPC = false; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3489: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].attacknpc = -1; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3490: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].RandomWalk = true; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3491: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].animNumber = 0x328; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3492: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].animUpdateRequired = true; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3493: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].updateRequired = true; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3494: class, interface, or enum expected return true; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3495: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3497: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3499: class, interface, or enum expected public boolean ResetAttackPlayer(int NPCID) { ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3502: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].StartKilling = 0; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3503: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].RandomWalk = true; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3504: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].animNumber = 0x328; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3505: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].animUpdateRequired = true; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3506: class, interface, or enum expected server.npcHandler.npcs[NPCID].updateRequired = true; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3507: class, interface, or enum expected return true; ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3508: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ .\src\NPCHandler.java:3510: class, interface, or enum expected } ^ 19 errors Finished.... Press any key to continue . . .
Heres The NPCHandler Code…

if (npcs[i].npcType == 98) { //npc id, the npc that says it. if (misc.random2(10) <= 1) //Time between saying your text. { npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdate = "Welcome To The Donator Zone! Thanks For Your Donation!"; //change that to what you want. } } }
317, delta

Read full topic
